findings.title: Uninitialized lastRewardBlock Contract State
findings.description: The miscalculation of the blockPassed variable in distributeRewards() function leads to higher reward distribution than expected.

findings.title: Improper Token Transfer in StakingPool
findings.description: The user with the TOKEN_SAVER_ROLE role can drain any token from the StakingPool contract.

findings.title: Centralized Control of State Variable
findings.description: Critical state variables can be updated any time by the controlling authorities without notifying users.

findings.title: Denial of Service with Huge Array Size
findings.description: The getTotalDeposit() and getDepositsOf() functions become unusable due to huge array size of depositsOf state.

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: The Solidity compiler version specified in the smart contracts was outdated, which has publicly known inherent bugs that may potentially be used to cause damage to the smart contracts or the users of the smart contracts.

findings.title: Improper Access Control in StakingPoolManager
findings.description: The access control design breaks the separation of duties (SoD) security concept by requiring the GOV_ROLE role to have the REWARD_DISTRIBUTOR_ROLE role.
